revised_title: Diffuse Reflexion of Neutrons by a Single Crystal: Theoretical Analysis and Experimental Observations
tldr: This article presents a theoretical analysis of the inelastic scattering of neutrons by crystals, focusing on the diffuse reflexion phenomenon. The authors outline the theory and derive properties of the diffuse reflexions. They then report on their experimental observations of diffuse reflexions in an iron crystal and compare the results with the theoretical predictions. The study provides insights into the interaction between neutrons and phonons in crystal structures and the dynamics of lattices.
